metadata.title: CVE-2019-15846 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Exim before 4.92.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code asroot via a trailing backslash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15846` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5
exim4-base - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5
exim4-config - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5
exim4-daemon-light - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5
eximon4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.86.2-2ubuntu2.5').
